t: Isaiah 63
The Lord’s Day of Vengeance

Who*pn is this coming from Edom in*ln crimson-stained garments from Bozrah — this*ln one who is splendid in his apparel, striding*ln in his formidable might? It*ln is I, proclaiming vindication, powerful*ln to save.
Why*ln are your clothes red, and*ln your garments like one who treads a winepress?

I*ln trampled the winepress alone, and*ln no one from the nations was with me. I*ln trampled them in my anger and*ln ground them underfoot in my fury; their*ln blood spattered my garments, and*ln all my clothes were stained.
For*ln I planned the day of vengeance, and*ln the year of my redemption came.
I*pn looked, but there was no one to help, and*ln I was amazed that no one assisted; so*ln my arm accomplished victory for me, and*ln my wrath assisted me.
I*pn crushed nations in my anger; I*ln made them drunk with my wrath and*ln poured out their blood on the ground.
Remembrance of Grace

I*pn will make known the Lord’s*s faithful love and*ln the Lord’s*s praiseworthy acts, because*ln of all the Lord*s has done for us — even*ln the many good things he*ln has done for the house of Israel, which*ln he did for them based on his compassion and*ln the abundance of his faithful love.
He*ln said, “They are indeed my people, children*ln who will not be disloyal,” and*ln he became their Savior.

In*ln all their suffering, he suffered, and*ln the angel of his presence saved them. He*ln redeemed them because*ln of his love and compassion; he*ln lifted them up and carried them all*ln the days of the past.
But*ln they rebelled and*ln grieved his Holy Spirit. So*ln he became their enemy and*ln fought against them.

Then*ln he remembered the days of the past, the*ln days of Moses and his people. Where*ln is he who brought them out of the sea with*ln the shepherds of his flock? Where*ln is he who put his Holy Spirit among the flock?
He*ln made his glorious strength available*ln at the right hand of Moses, divided*ln the water before them to*ln make an eternal name for himself,
and*ln led them through the depths like*ln a horse in the wilderness, so*ln that they did not stumble.
Like*pn cattle that go down into the valley, the*ln Spirit of the Lord*s gave them rest. You*ln led your people this way to*ln make a glorious name for yourself.
Israel’s Prayer
Look*pn down from heaven and see from*ln your lofty home - holy and beautiful. Where*ln is your zeal and your might? Your*ln yearning and your compassion are*ln withheld from me.
Yet*ln you are our Father, even*ln though Abraham does not know us and*ln Israel doesn’t recognize us. You,*ln Lord,*s are our Father; your*ln name is Our Redeemer from*ln Ancient Times.
Why,*ln Lord,*s do you make us stray from your ways? You*ln harden our hearts so we do not fear you. Return,*ln because of your servants, the*ln tribes of your heritage.
Your*ln holy people had a possession for*ln a little while, but*ln our enemies have trampled down your*ln sanctuary.
We*ln have become like those you never ruled, like*ln those who did not bear your name.
